parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
Tryphaena, a Christian woman in Rome. From truphe; luxurious; Tryphoena, a Christian woman.
Tryphosa, a Christian woman in Rome, perhaps a sister of Tryphaena. From truphe; luxuriating; Tryphosa, a Christian female.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Plural
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Persis, name of a Christian lady in Rome. A Persian woman; Persis, a Christian female.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
